channel.title: Help me on ' Ring of charos(a) '
channel.description:
Guys I tried 1000 Times and i still fail =\
How i make it all stat's 0's ?
Not on * Cfg - Data - Items * " Not Working here "
You've guys any idea how i reset the stat's to 0's ?
[IMG]http://i50.tinypic.com/2uz46pz.png[/img]

item.title: Help me on ' Ring of charos(a) '
item.dc:creator: @99rangek0 99rangek0
item.description:
@99rangek0 wrote:

Thats says ring of charos(u)
is there a ring of charos(a) in the item.cfg? Or is it just a typo when the name was put in?

Read full topic
item.source: Help me on ' Ring of charos(a) '

item.title: Help me on ' Ring of charos(a) '
item.dc:creator: @Jaegon Jaegon
item.description:
@Jaegon wrote:

[quote=“99rangek0, post:2, topic:448551”]Been a while since I worked on a 317, but if I remember correctly its item.cfg.
And in that file you’ll search for it, Ring_Of_Charos(a) , they use underscores(_) instead of spaces for the names in item.cfg, and to the right of the name will be #'s, Those #'s are the stats. Change them to whatever stats you want


if this is what you were talking about saying you tried it, make sure it's being compiled.[/quote]Hmm ? Not working


[IMG]http://i50.tinypic.com/2uf5cfk.png[/img]

Read full topic
item.source: Help me on ' Ring of charos(a) '

item.title: Help me on ' Ring of charos(a) '
item.dc:creator: @99rangek0 99rangek0
item.description:
@99rangek0 wrote:

Been a while since I worked on a 317, but if I remember correctly its item.cfg.
And in that file you’ll search for it, Ring_Of_Charos(a) , they use underscores(_) instead of spaces for the names in item.cfg, and to the right of the name will be #'s, Those #'s are the stats. Change them to whatever stats you want


if this is what you were talking about saying you tried it, make sure it's being compiled.

Read full topic
